result.execSummary:
The defendant Cheryl A Riel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow transfer to Winnebago County or Waushara County.
Court will allow for early termination of probation at any point after 6 months once all restitution, fines/costs are paid and Agent deems appropriate.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is to be paid to the victim's insurance company and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
9-23-2016 -   Pursuant to Supreme Court decision in State v Elward, 2015 WI App 51, 363, DNA surcharge is vacated and modified to zero.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Criminal Thinking Class and follow through if deemed appropriate by Agent.
No contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint.

records.addlTxt:
Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Cheryl A Riel in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations to the court.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations to the court.


Court orders the following:
WITHHELD SENTENCE

Term of Probation: 12 Months.
Court will allow transfer to Oshkosh County or Waushara county.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Criminal Thinking Class and follow through if deemed appropriate by agent.
40 Hours of Community Service to be completed.  
Court will allow for early termination of probation at any point after 6 months once all restitution, fines/costs are paid and agent deems appropriate.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
No contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

RESTITUTION:  $1,092.63 (to be paid to the Victim's insurance company - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  $200
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
